text: Marian Hall Seldes (August 23, 1928 - October 6, 2014) was an American actress. She was known for her roles in Tom and Huck, Home Alone 3, The Haunting, If These Walls Could Talk 2, and in Mona Lisa Smile. She won a Tony Award in 1967. == Biography == Seldes was born on August 23, 1928 in New York City, New York. She is of Russian-Jewish descent. Seldes studied at the Neighborhood Playhouse. Seldes was married to Julian Claman from 1953 until they divorced in 1961. Her marriage to Julian was abusive. Seldes left the marriage after her father noticed marks on Seldes's face. Then she was married to Garson Kanin from 1990 until his death in 1999. She had one daughter with Julian, Katherine. Seldes died from dementia-related problems at her apartment in New York City, New York, aged 86. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1928 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia Category:Jewish American actors Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American voice actors Category:American stage actors Category:Actors from New York City Category:Tony Award winning actors
